text:
William Harold Greider (August 6, 1936 – December 25, 2019) was an American journalist and author. He wrote mainly about economics. He was national affairs correspondent for "The Nation". He also wrote for the "Rolling Stone" magazine during the 1980s and 1990s, and worked as an on-air correspondent for "Frontline" on PBS.
Greider died at his home in Washington, D.C. from congestive heart failure-related problems, aged 83, on December 25, 2019.
